00027 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_FILTER
00028 
00029 #include <linux/fs.h>
00030 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00031 #include <lvfs.h>
00032 #include <obd_class.h>
00033 
00034 #include "ptlrpc_internal.h"
00035 
00036 /* refine later and change to seqlock or simlar from libcfs */
00037 /* Debugging check only needed during development */
00038 #ifdef OBD_CTXT_DEBUG
00039 # define ASSERT_CTXT_MAGIC(magic) LASSERT((magic) == OBD_RUN_CTXT_MAGIC)
00040 # define ASSERT_NOT_KERNEL_CTXT(msg) LASSERTF(!segment_eq(get_fs(), get_ds()),\
00041                                               msg)
00042 # define ASSERT_KERNEL_CTXT(msg) LASSERTF(segment_eq(get_fs(), get_ds()), msg)
00043 #else
00044 # define ASSERT_CTXT_MAGIC(magic) do {} while(0)
00045 # define ASSERT_NOT_KERNEL_CTXT(msg) do {} while(0)
00046 # define ASSERT_KERNEL_CTXT(msg) do {} while(0)
00047 #endif
00048 
00049 /* push / pop to root of obd store */
00050 void push_ctxt(struct lvfs_run_ctxt *save, struct lvfs_run_ctxt *new_ctx)
00051 {
00052         /* if there is underlaying dt_device then push_ctxt is not needed */
00053         if (new_ctx->dt != NULL)
00054                 return;
00055 
00056         //ASSERT_NOT_KERNEL_CTXT("already in kernel context!\n");
00057         ASSERT_CTXT_MAGIC(new_ctx->magic);
00058         OBD_SET_CTXT_MAGIC(save);
00059 
00060         save->fs = get_fs();
00061         LASSERT(ll_d_count(current->fs->pwd.dentry));
00062         LASSERT(ll_d_count(new_ctx->pwd));
00063         save->pwd = dget(current->fs->pwd.dentry);
00064         save->pwdmnt = mntget(current->fs->pwd.mnt);
00065         save->umask = current_umask();
00066 
00067         LASSERT(save->pwd);
00068         LASSERT(save->pwdmnt);
00069         LASSERT(new_ctx->pwd);
00070         LASSERT(new_ctx->pwdmnt);
00071 
00072         current->fs->umask = 0; /* umask already applied on client */
00073         set_fs(new_ctx->fs);
00074         ll_set_fs_pwd(current->fs, new_ctx->pwdmnt, new_ctx->pwd);
00075 }
00076 EXPORT_SYMBOL(push_ctxt);
00077 
00078 void pop_ctxt(struct lvfs_run_ctxt *saved, struct lvfs_run_ctxt *new_ctx)
00079 {
00080         /* if there is underlaying dt_device then pop_ctxt is not needed */
00081         if (new_ctx->dt != NULL)
00082                 return;
00083 
00084         ASSERT_CTXT_MAGIC(saved->magic);
00085         ASSERT_KERNEL_CTXT("popping non-kernel context!\n");
00086 
00087         LASSERTF(current->fs->pwd.dentry == new_ctx->pwd, "%p != %p\n",
00088                  current->fs->pwd.dentry, new_ctx->pwd);
00089         LASSERTF(current->fs->pwd.mnt == new_ctx->pwdmnt, "%p != %p\n",
00090                  current->fs->pwd.mnt, new_ctx->pwdmnt);
00091 
00092         set_fs(saved->fs);
00093         ll_set_fs_pwd(current->fs, saved->pwdmnt, saved->pwd);
00094 
00095         dput(saved->pwd);
00096         mntput(saved->pwdmnt);
00097         current->fs->umask = saved->umask;
00098 }
00099 EXPORT_SYMBOL(pop_ctxt);
00100 
00101 /* utility to rename a file */
00102 int lustre_rename(struct dentry *dir, struct vfsmount *mnt,
00103                   char *oldname, char *newname)
00104 {
00105         struct dentry *dchild_old, *dchild_new;
00106         int err = 0;
00107         ENTRY;
00108 
00109         ASSERT_KERNEL_CTXT("kernel doing rename outside kernel context\n");
00110         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "renaming file %.*s to %.*s\n",
00111                (int)strlen(oldname), oldname, (int)strlen(newname), newname);
00112 
00113         dchild_old = ll_lookup_one_len(oldname, dir, strlen(oldname));
00114         if (IS_ERR(dchild_old))
00115                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(dchild_old));
00116 
00117         if (!dchild_old->d_inode)
00118                 GOTO(put_old, err = -ENOENT);
00119 
00120         dchild_new = ll_lookup_one_len(newname, dir, strlen(newname));
00121         if (IS_ERR(dchild_new))
00122                 GOTO(put_old, err = PTR_ERR(dchild_new));
00123 
00124         err = ll_vfs_rename(dir->d_inode, dchild_old, dir->d_inode, dchild_new);
00125 
00126         dput(dchild_new);
00127 put_old:
00128         dput(dchild_old);
00129         RETURN(err);
00130 }
